title: I05-4010

sentences.text: In this paper we present our recent work on harvesting English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong from the Web and aligning them to the subparagraph level via utilizing the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy .
Basic methodology and practical techniques are reported in detail .
The resultant bilingual corpus , 10.4 M English words and 18.3 M Chinese characters , is an authoritative and comprehensive text collection covering the specific and special domain of HK laws .
It is particularly valuable to empirical MT research .
This piece of work has also laid a foundation for exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts in a larger volume from the Web .

summary: In this paper we present our recent work on harvesting English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong from the Web and aligning them to the subparagraph level via utilizing the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy . Basic methodology and practical techniques are reported in detail . The resultant bilingual corpus , 10.4 M English words and 18.3 M Chinese characters , is an authoritative and comprehensive text collection covering the specific and special domain of HK laws . It is particularly valuable to empirical MT research . This piece of work has also laid a foundation for exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts in a larger volume from the Web .

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates a relationship of contemporaneity or relevance between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject (our recent work) has something to do with, features, or embodies the object (this paper), which exists or occurs at the same time.

Predicate-are_reported_in_detail_about.label: are reported in detail about
Predicate-are_reported_in_detail_about.description: The predicate 'are reported in detail about' indicates a relationship where the subject provides an exhaustive and detailed account of the object. The subject serves as the source or authority that presents information about the object, which can be a concept, process, methodology, etc.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' connects a subject to its inherent or essential nature, indicating that the subject possesses or embodies the qualities described by the object. It can be used to establish an identity between the subject and the object, suggesting that they share common characteristics, properties, or attributes.

Predicate-is_valuable_to.label: is valuable to
Predicate-is_valuable_to.description: The predicate 'is valuable to' indicates a relationship where the subject has significance or importance for the object. This connection implies that the subject provides benefits, insights, or value to the object, which may be an individual, group, organization, or even society as a whole.

Predicate-has_laid.label: has laid
Predicate-has_laid.description: Indicates that something (typically an idea or concept) was established, founded, or created by the subject. The predicate 'has laid' suggests a sense of foundation, groundwork, or precedent being set for the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a more specific or detailed instance of the object concept. In other words, it represents an is-a relationship where the subject is a narrower category within the scope defined by the object.
